title: When was the Philippines discovered? - Quora

response.answer_text: Depends by WHO. The Micronesians have discovered it around 20 000 years ago. India had conection with the islands at least since 8 000 (or more ) years ago. The Chinese also several thousand years. And thats only the ones we know about. Magellan was the first European who made official contact on his voyage around the world - March 16 of 1521 - (but got himself killed, April 15, by meddling into internal struggles of island chiefs)

If a country was not discovered by a white or western civilization then it doesn’t count. That’s what seemed to happened with the Philippines. Our history will show that Ferdinand Magellan discovered the Philippines in 1521. But before that, traders from China and other neighboring countries have been visiting the Philippines way before Magellan mistook the country for India.

If one means: discovered by the Europeans, it would be Magellan's discovery in 1521; however, a place can be discovered many times and each is valid. The Malayan people were followed by people from India, Muslim East Indies, and China, all before Magellan.
The Philippines was discovered on March 15, 1521. By Ferdinand Magellan of Spain . Named after King Philip. Was under Spaniard for 378 years. Was sold to the U. S.
